result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Transfer is allowed to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to Radio Shack to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contact with Radio Shack stores or their employees. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kevin M Butler in court with Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Williams Buttery makes statements regarding sentencing.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR     **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Radio Shack stores or their employees

RESTITUTION:  $2,485.00 to Radio Shack (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**
ProSe Checklist
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-09-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Kevin M Butler in court with Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Williams Buttery requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 10-02-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Kevin M Butler in court with Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Williams Buttery requests an adjournment as she is still waiting for discovery.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kevin M Butler in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he still has not seen the public defender.  Court adjourns so Defendant can see public defender.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint or any employees of the business.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Kevin M Butler in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
